1.text: Is there not a warfare to man on earth? And as the days of an hireling his days?

2.text: As a servant desireth the shadow, And as a hireling expecteth his wage,

3.text: So I have been caused to inherit months of vanity, And nights of misery they numbered to me.

4.text: If I lay down then I said, ‘When do I rise!’ And evening hath been measured, And I have been full of tossings till dawn.

5.text: Clothed hath been my flesh with worms, And a clod of dust, My skin hath been shrivelled and is loathsome,

6.text: My days swifter than a weaving machine, And they are consumed without hope.

7.text: Remember Thou that my life is a breath, Mine eye turneth not back to see good.

8.text: The eye of my beholder beholdeth me not. Thine eyes are upon me—and I am not.

9.text: Consumed hath been a cloud, and it goeth, So he who is going down to Sheol cometh not up.

10.text: He turneth not again to his house, Nor doth his place discern him again.

11.text: Also I—I withhold not my mouth—I speak in the distress of my spirit, I talk in the bitterness of my soul.

12.text: A sea -monster am I, or a dragon, That thou settest over me a guard?

13.text: When I said, ‘My bed doth comfort me,’ He taketh away in my talking my couch.

14.text: And thou hast affrighted me with dreams, And from visions thou terrifiest me,

15.text: And my soul chooseth strangling, Death rather than my bones.

16.text: I have wasted away—not to the age do I live. Cease from me, for my days are vanity.

17.text: What is man that Thou dost magnify him? And that Thou settest unto him Thy heart?

18.text: And inspectest him in the mornings, In the evenings dost try him?

19.text: How long dost Thou not look from me? Thou dost not desist till I swallow my spittle.

20.text: I have sinned, what do I to Thee, O watcher of man? Why hast Thou set me for a mark to Thee, And I am for a burden to myself—and what?

21.text: Thou dost not take away my transgression, And cause to pass away mine iniquity, Because now, for dust I lie down: And Thou hast sought me—and I am not!
